title: Alexander J. Coffin
text:
Alexander J. Coffin (December 16, 1794 – April 23, 1868 <a href="Poughkeepsie%2C%20New%20York">Poughkeepsie</a>, <a href="Dutchess%20County%2C%20New%20York">Dutchess County, New York</a>) was an American politician from <a href="New%20York%20%28state%29">New York</a>.
Life.
He was the son of Eliab Coffin (c. 1756–1841) and Mary (Jenkins) Coffin (b. 1761). On April 8, 1819, he married Lydia Stratton (1798–1832), and they had three children.
He was a <a href="presidential%20elector">presidential elector</a> in <a href="1824%20United%20States%20presidential%20election">1824</a>.
He was a member of the <a href="New%20York%20State%20Senate">New York State Senate</a> (8th D.) in <a href="71st%20New%20York%20State%20Legislature">1848</a> and <a href="72nd%20New%20York%20State%20Legislature">1849</a>.
He was buried at the Friends Ground in Poughkeepsie.
